text: TOKYO Japan will use specialised syringes capable of extracting six doses of coronavirus vaccine from each Pfizer vial from the week of April 12 to inoculate medical workers, Taro Kono, the minister overseeing the vaccination effort, said on Friday.Most of Japans stock of syringes consists of regular versions that can draw just five doses from each vial, sparking fears that millions of doses could be wasted.
